2.text: And Eliu the son of Barachel the Buzite, of the kindred of Ram, was angry and was moved to indignation : now he was angry against Job, because he said he was just before God.

3.text: And he was angry with his friends because they had not found a reasonable answer, but only had condemned Job.

4.text: So Eliu waited while Job was speaking, because they were his elders that were speaking.

5.text: But when he saw that the three were not able to answer, he was exceedingly angry.

6.text: Then Eliu the son of Barachel the Buzite answered and said : I am younger in days, and you are more ancient; therefore hanging down my head, I was afraid to shew you my opinion.

7.text: For I hoped that greater age would speak, and that a multitude of years would teach wisdom.

8.text: But, as I see, there is a spirit in men, and the inspiration of the Almighty giveth understanding.

9.text: They that are aged are not the wise men, neither do the ancients understand judgment.

10.text: Therefore I will speak : Hearken to me, I also will shew you my wisdom.

11.text: For I have waited for your words, I have given ear to your wisdom, as long as you were disputing in words.

12.text: And as long as I thought you said some thing, I considered : but, as I see, there is none of you that can convince Job, and answer his words.

13.text: Lest you should say : We have found wisdom, God hath cast him down, not man.

14.text: He hath spoken nothing to me, and I will not answer him according to your words.

15.text: They were afraid, and answered no more, and they left off speaking.

16.text: Therefore because I have waited, and they have not spoken : they stood, and answered no more :

17.text: I also will answer my part, and will shew my knowledge.

19.text: Behold, my belly is as new wine which wanteth vent, which bursteth the new vessels.

20.text: I will speak and take breath a little : I will open my lips, and will answer.

21.text: I will not accept the person of man, and I will not level God with man.

22.text: For I know not how long I shall continue, and whether after a while my Maker may take me away.
